# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that solves this problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')   # Split string into words
    result = ""            # Initialize empty string to store wrapped string

    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width   # Check if adding the current word will exceed max width
            result *= "\n"  # If so, start a new line
        end
        
        # Add the current word to the string and a space in front of it for readability
        result *= " $word"
    end
    
    return result
end
```

You can call this function by passing your string and the desired text width:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit", 15))
```
This will output:
```text
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit
```
